lines.text: Dr. Daniel E. Jenkins
Q. I understand that your organization issued a statement
in l96o which said, among other things, that "recent studies
show that cigarette smoking is a factor in such crippling
lung diseases as chronic bronchitis and emphysema (see
Transcript of Senate Hearings. P. 222). Why didn't the
statement say that cigarette smoking is suspected_to be a
factor, as you have said here today?
Q. Do you know that the Surgeon General's Committee said
concerning the information about emphysema and bronchitis
that the data are insufficient at present to be of value
in the estimation of the public health hazaid of smoking?
(The statement on page 294 reads: "Thus morbidity data are
insufficient at present to be of value in the estimation of
the public health hazard of smoking." Morbidity data means
data indicating how many cases of a disease exist.)
Q. You say that"emphysema doesn't lend itself to easy
definition." Isn't it true that there is still a great deal
of medical dispute over what actually constitutes bronchitis
or emphysema? So isn't it a fact that we ought to be careful

full_text:
Dr. Daniel E. Jenkins
Q. I understand that your organization issued a statement
in l96o which said, among other things, that "recent studies
show that cigarette smoking is a factor in such crippling
lung diseases as chronic bronchitis and emphysema (see
Transcript of Senate Hearings. P. 222). Why didn't the
statement say that cigarette smoking is suspected_to be a
factor, as you have said here today?
Q. Do you know that the Surgeon General's Committee said
concerning the information about emphysema and bronchitis
that the data are insufficient at present to be of value
in the estimation of the public health hazaid of smoking?
(The statement on page 294 reads: "Thus morbidity data are
insufficient at present to be of value in the estimation of
the public health hazard of smoking." Morbidity data means
1005067317
data indicating how many cases of a disease exist.)
Q. You say that"emphysema doesn't lend itself to easy
definition." Isn't it true that there is still a great deal
of medical dispute over what actually constitutes bronchitis
or emphysema? So isn't it a fact that we ought to be careful
